project_description: A simple Flutter app that switches text between 'Cat' and 'Dog' when clicked, using the Cubit pattern for state management.
architecture_overview: The app follows a standard Flutter architecture with a focus on modularity. It uses the Cubit pattern for state management, separating the UI, business logic, and data models into different layers.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> HomeScreen: launch
HomeScreen -> AnimalCubit: get initial state
AnimalCubit -> AnimalState: return initial state
HomeScreen -> AnimalText: display initial state
User -> AnimalText: click
AnimalText -> AnimalCubit: toggleAnimal
AnimalCubit -> AnimalState: update state
AnimalState -> AnimalCubit: return new state
AnimalCubit -> HomeScreen: provide new state
HomeScreen -> AnimalText: update display
@enduml
state_management_flow: State is managed using the AnimalCubit. The initial state is fetched when the HomeScreen is loaded. When the user clicks on the AnimalText widget, an event is dispatched to the AnimalCubit to toggle the animal text and icon. The new state is then emitted and the UI updates accordingly.
navigation_flow: The app has a single screen, HomeScreen. When the app is launched, the HomeScreen is displayed. The navigation structure is minimal given the single-screen nature of the app.
